transcript: the first things we say in the relationships are the things that we believe about ourselves I'm Type A I'm organized I'm on time or I'm kind of messy I'm not that clean I uh tend to be late what's crazy to me is that a lot of people make these labels these assertions about who they are and they will be counter to what they're actually trying to do it's like saying oh I'm a lazy ass why would you ever say that about yourself like why you're basically training them treat me like a lazy ass expect me to behave in a way that a lazy ass would and then when they start subtly speaking to you in that way it reinforces the behavior that you have which is ultimately not what you wanted to begin with
